results.title: Craig and Steven
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Why can’t they be like we were?”.
An exploration of the concept of masculinity. Craig is a ballet student and Steve is an Australian rules footballer. They discuss their views of life.

results.title: Gary
results.creator_credit: David Haythornthwaite, Tom Manefield and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Why can’t they be like we were?”.
After a period of abrasive conflict Gary’s parents have separated. The effect of this is shown on the whole family, but Gary is so deeply affected, that his insecurities produce a stomach ulcer. Suitable for lower and middle secondary levels.

results.title: Amy
results.creator_credit: Phil Noyce, Tom Manefield and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Why can’t they be like we were?”.
Amy is a 16 year-old aboriginal girl from the country now living in Sydney. She faces many problems at school, in getting a job, and in the community because of her colour. Photography by Dean Semler.

group_works.title: The Mammalian heart
group_works.creator_credit: A K Lee, D Moyan, Australian Academy of Science and Educational Media International

results.title: The Mammalian heart
results.creator_credit: A K Lee, D Moyan, Australian Academy of Science and Educational Media International
results.brief_description:
Episode number 11 of Series “The Web of life”.
Illustrates the structure and functioning of the mammalian heart by using the hearts of a sheep and a dog as examples. The sheep’s heart is used to show external features and internal structure, while the appearance of a living heart is seen during a chest operation on a dog at a veterinary clinic. The passage of blood through the heart, lungs and major vessels is observed through X-ray process. Suitable for upper secondary level.
results.creator_credit_for_label: A K Lee, D Moyan, Australian Academy of Science and Educational Media International
